abstract: The collapse of IndyMac, one of the nation’s largest mortgage lenders, was the most vivid example to date of the dangers confronting banks and their investors.
snippet: The collapse of IndyMac, one of the nation’s largest mortgage lenders, was the most vivid example to date of the dangers confronting banks and their investors.
lead_paragraph: PASADENA, Calif.  After his mortgage company nearly crashed a decade ago, Michael W. Perry set a new course. He bought a bank so the company, soon rechristened IndyMac Bank, would never run short of money again.

headline.main: Lax Lending Standards Led to IndyMac’s Downfall
headline.print_headline: The Downfall of a California Dreamer
